Online shopping sites also pamper you with enticing discounts on the best-selling cameras from Nikon, Canon, Manfrotto, Sony, Envie, and Sigma regardless of whether its sale season or not.</span></p>\n<span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\"> </span>\n\n<p><span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\">Pout, pose and click! Dont you just love cameras? Imagine a world without selfies, no profile pictures, no photography exhibitions and nothing to capture the breath-taking sunset. Basically, imagine a world without cameras. Difficult, right? It doesnt matter if you are not trained as a photographer, you can still take good pictures provided you have the right camera. And if you are a professional, then there is no better way to improve your skills other than upgrade what you already own. So, knowing a thing or two about the different types of cameras is a must. Give this article a quick read, and make a wise buying decision.</span></p>\n<span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\"> </span>\n\n<p><span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\"><b>DSLR cameras to get the most beautiful snapshot of a moment</b></span></p>\n<span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\"> </span>\n\n<p><span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\">DSLR cameras (Digital Single-Lens Reflex Camera) are being widely bought and used today for various reasons that make them hugely popular. With large sensor area, high shutter speeds ( can capture up to 10 frames per second), much better sensitivity to light, ability to use different lenses for different situations, great control over the depth of field( the ability to create beautiful bokeh) and many more such reasons prompt photographers into buying DSLR cameras online. It doesn't matter whether you want to click the photo of a wide landscape for which you would need a wide-angle lens like the Canon 24mm f/2.8 lens, or you want to do some bird photography using the telephoto lens like the Nikon 300mm f/4 lens, or clock someone's portrait using portrait lens, they all can be mounted based on your requirement in to the DSLR camera. Go for a Nikon D3300 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6 DSLR camera, Canon EOS 13000 DSLR, Nikon D 810, Pentax K5, Sony Alpha ILCE 6000Y or any such best DSLR cameras. Browse to find the best DSLR camera price online to shop for it at the most reasonable rate.</span></p>\n<span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\"> </span>\n\n<p><span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\"><b>What are the Different Types of Cameras?</b></span></p>\n<span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\"> </span>\n\n<p><span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\"><b><a href=\"/cameras/instant-cameras/pr?sid=jek,p31,ysu\">Instant Cameras</a></b></span></p>\n<span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\"> </span>\n\n<p><span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\">The name says it all, instant cameras are a cool balance of vintage cameras that come with film rolls and modern digital cameras. Fujifilm has an adorable collection of colourful instant cameras with some of them shaped like Hello Kitty. These cameras instantly roll out copies of the pictures you click. Some versions of these cameras feature a mirror near the lens so you can take selfies. Play around with your instant camera, take close up shots of objects or capture dreamy images by adjusting the brightness of your camera. Like all cameras, instant ones are also usually powered by batteries.</span></p>\n<span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\"> </span>\n\n<p><span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\"><b>Point-and-shoot</b></span></p>\n<span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\"> </span>\n\n<p><span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\"><a href=\"/cameras/point-and-shoot/pr?sid=jek,p31,nxa\">Point and shoot cameras</a> are still cameras that are very compact in size and of lightweight that you can easily slip them into your pockets. They are primarily meant for simple photography operation with a fixed lens that has either focus-free or autofocus capability. You don't need to keep changing lenses while taking pictures in different situations and they also have a massive depth of field. Nikon B700, Sony DSC-W830, Nikon Coolpix B500, Canon IXUS 185 point and shoot cameras are some good ones using which you can learn basic photography. You can adjust the settings like mode and exposure automatically, so you dont have to do much other than holding the camera steadily. Also, they are usually compact, so you can take them along while going to parties or trips, and capture all your favourite moments. However, advanced point-and-shoot ones come with better features, and are quite a rage these days.</span></p>\n<span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\"> </span>\n\n<p><span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\">A couple of things to check with DSLR cameras is their MegaPixel count which describes the resolution, battery type, sensor type and size, and shutter speed. DSLR cameras with good sensor give you pictures that are sharp and detailed even when enlarged. A cameras sensor size gives you an idea of how wide a view it can cover. The processor of a DSLR camera is another detail to look into. Cameras with a good processor reduce noise and give you equally crisp pictures in both bright and dim lighting. DSLR cameras like the Canon EOS 1300D feature Wi-Fi connectivity and built-in NFC technology which let you transfer pictures and videos from your camera to your smartphone with a finger tap.</span></p>\n<span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\"> </span>\n\n<p><span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\"><b>DSLR Cameras</b></span></p>\n<span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\"> </span>\n\n<p><span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\">A couple of things to check with <a href=\"/cameras/dslr-mirrorless/pr?sid=jek,p31,trv\">DSLR cameras</a> is their MP, battery type, sensor type and size, and shutter speed. DSLR cameras with good sensor give you pictures that are sharp and detailed even when enlarged. A cameras sensor size gives you an idea of how wide a view it can cover. The processor of a DSLR camera is another detail to look into. Cameras with a good processor reduce noise and give you equally crisp pictures in both bright and dim lighting. DSLR cameras like the Canon EOS 1300D feature Wi-Fi connectivity & <a href=\"/q/4k-video-camera\">4K Video Camera</a> and built-in NFC technology which let you transfer pictures and videos from your camera to your smartphone with a finger tap.</span></p>\n\n<p><span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\"><b>Action Cameras</b></span></p>\n<span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\"> </span>\n\n<p><span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\">Dont want to be weighed down with heavy equipment when hiking? Ditch your DSLR camera for compact <a href=\"/cameras/sports-action/pr?sid=jek,p31,s3q\">action camera</a>s. These cameras are more travel-friendly and are usually waterproof. They can be mounted on almost any surface which helps when you want to click pictures of the view from different angles. Action cameras with the voice control feature are innovative and let you enjoy hands-free control of your camera so you can concentrate on your activity.</span></p>\n\n<p><span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\"><b>Mirrorless</b></span></p>\n<span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\"> </span>\n\n<p><span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\">These cameras are not that popular when it comes to their features. They usually have interchangeable lenses and dont have the usual mirror, which makes them a lightweight and compact option when compared to DSLR cameras.</span></p>\n\n<p><span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\"><b>Camcorder</b></span></p>\n<span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\"> </span>\n\n<p><span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\">A combination of a video camera and a video recorder, a <a href=\"/cameras/camcorders/pr?sid=jek,p31,enu\">camcorder</a> is great for recording. The new models also have the luxury of a camera, as they allow you to take pictures as well.</span></p>\n\n<p><span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\"><b>Sports and Action Cameras</b></span></p>\n<span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\"> </span>\n\n<p><span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\">Dont want to be weighed down with heavy equipment when hiking? Get yourself a compact action camera. Sports and Action cameras are more travel-friendly and are usually waterproof. They can be mounted on almost any surface which helps when you want to click pictures of the view from different angles. Why should I buy a DSLR camera?</b></span></p>\n<span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\"> </span>\n\n<p><span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\">Digital Single Lens Reflex (DSLR) cameras are being widely bought and used today for various reasons that make them hugely popular. With large sensor area, high shutter speeds( can capture up to 10 frames per second), much better sensitivity to light, ability to use different lenses for different situations, great control over the depth of field( the ability to create beautiful bokeh) and many more such reasons prompt photographers into buying DSLR cameras online. These let you change lenses and hence you can manually set exposure and focus. They deliver crispier and cleaner images as they have larger internal image sensors than point-and-shoot cameras.</span></p>\n\n<p><span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\"><b>2. What resolution do I need to get sharp photos?</b></span></p>\n<span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\"> </span>\n\n<p><span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\">For printing out decently clear photographs you can use cameras with the resolution between 16 MP to 24 MP. The higher the resolution, the clearer will be the photos. If you only wish to post photos on the web or have a soft copy of the same, you don't really need cameras with very high resolution. You can go for Canon EOS 100D DSLR camera which is of 18 MP or cameras from Nikon, Sony and other good brands.</span></p>\n\n<p><span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\"><b>3. What is the difference between actual pixel count and effective pixel count?</b></span></p>\n<span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\"> </span>\n\n<p><span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\">Some brands publish two-pixel count numbers. These are the actual and effective pixel count numbers. The actual pixel count number is the actual pixel numbers present on the sensor. On the other hand, effective number is the number of pixels on the sensor that are used for image formation. All the pixels are not used for image formation.</span></p>\n\n<p><span style=\"font-family:Verdana,Geneva,sans-serif;\"><b>4.
